org.xbib.standardnumber
Class ARK

java.lang.Object
  org.xbib.standardnumber.ARK
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<ARK>, StandardNumber
public class ARK
extends Object
implements Comparable<ARK>, StandardNumber

ARK Archival Resource Key An ARK is a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that is a multi-purpose identifier for information objects of any type. An ARK contains the label ark: after the hostname, an URL request terminated by '?' returns a brief metadata record, and an URL request terminated by '??' returns metadata that includes a commitment statement from the current service provider. The ARK and its inflections ('?' and '??') gain access to three facets of a provider's ability to provide persistence. Implicit in the design of the ARK scheme is that persistence is purely a matter of service and not a property of a naming syntax.

See Also:
ARK IETF RFC, 10 years ARK
